summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons incident report detailing the suicide attempt of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on July 23, 2019. The report describes staff finding Epstein unresponsive with a homemade rope around his neck in his SHU cell and the subsequent response.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who attempted to hang himself in SHU cell 124 at MCC New York on July 23, 2019.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who was at the cell door stating that Epstein had attempted to hang himself.

persons.name: Silva
persons.context: Staff officer who, with the reporting officer, heard noise from the cell, grabbed door keys, and called for assistance.

persons.name: Anderson
persons.context: Ops Lt. Anderson arrived on the scene after the initial response.

connections.description: Were cellmates in SHU cell 124 at MCC New York.
Staff officer who responded to the incident involving inmate Epstein.

events.title: Epstein's Suicide Attempt in MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein attempted to hang himself with a homemade orange rope in SHU cell 124 at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York. He was found unresponsive but breathing by staff and his cellmate.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein attempted suicide by hanging in his prison cell on July 23, 2019, prior to his eventual death.
The incident occurred in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
Epstein was found with an orange homemade rope around his neck, was breathing but unresponsive.
His cellmate, Tartaglione, alerted staff to the incident.
The report documents the initial staff response and the beginning of a disciplinary process for the act of self-mutilation.
